data.title: A Guide To Bangalore Metro Timings: Lines, Routes & Tips
data.meta_description: Learn everything you need to know about Bangalore Metro timings, routes and tips for a great travel experience in the city.
data.text:
Travelling in Bangalore is daunting, and everyone can agree! But, putting an end to your worries, Namma Metro surfaces as India’s second-longest operational metro network behind Delhi. From Baiyappanahalli to Mysuru Road and Nagasandra to Silk Institute, the Bangalore metro route spans 73.75 km and has 66 stations. With significant extensions on the horizon, the BLR metro system is set to lay an additional 37 km Hebbal-Sarjapur line. Whether you want to reach Kadugodi from K.R. Pura or Yeshwantpur to Silk Institute avoiding the exhaustive traffic, it’s possible! To help you navigate your way around Namma Bengaluru, we will help you with Bangalore metro timings, routes, and lines.

Namma Bengaluru Metro Overview

Namma Metro operated by Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) consists of two main routes: the Red Line and the Green Line. This line intersects at Kempegowda (Majestic) station and provides a smooth interchange for passengers. Let’s quickly gather the necessary information about Bangalore metro train route:

Feature Description Operator Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited Headquarter BMTC Complex, Shanthinagar Started On October 20, 2011 Annual Commuters 232.8 million Type of Transit Rapid transit Number of Stations 66 operational stations Train Length 6 coaches Top Speed 80 km/h First Metro in Bangalore 5:00 am Last Metro in Bangalore 11:00 pm Fare Structure Minimum Rs. 10, maximum Rs. 60-100 depending on the distance Lines Purple Line and Green Line are functional. Blue Line, Grey Line, Yellow Line, Orange Line, Red Line, and Pink Line are under construction.

Also read: How To Rent A House In Bangalore: Easy Tips To Consider

Timings of Bangalore Metro

Bangalore Metro operates from 5:00 am to 11:00 pm, which is convenient for morning commuters and late-night commuters. Trains run at different frequencies throughout the day:

1. Peak hours (08:00 am – 11:00 pm and 5 pm – 8:00 pm): Trains arrive every 4-5 minutes.

2. Non-peak hours: Trains arrive every 8-10 minutes.

Namma Metro Bangalore (Days) Bangalore Metro Timings Frequency of Namma Bengaluru Metro Monday-Friday 5:00 AM to 11:05 PM Every 4.5-15 minutes Sunday 7:00 AM to 11:05 PM Every 8-15 minutes 2nd & 4th Saturdays and Public Holidays 5:00 AM to 11:05 PM Every 8-15 minutes 1st, 3rd, and 5th Saturdays 5:00 AM to 11:05 PM Every 4.5-15 minutes

Bangalore Metro Routes and Lines

Bangalore metro route and timings are designed to ease traffic congestion and ensure efficient transportation. Currently, there are Purple Line and Green Line connecting the key areas of the city. However, three under-construction lines, namely, Yellow, Pink, and Blue are underway. Below we detail the current lines and future expansions for better understanding:

1. Purple Line

Easing traffic congestion during the peak hours, the Purple Line connects Whitefield with Challaghatta. With 37 stations, the metro line spans 39.4 km including prominent areas like Cubbon Park Metro Station and Majestic Station. Since opening in 2011, the line has become a go-to for daily commuters. Plus, on weekdays, the frequency is every 4.5 minutes-15 minutes and on weekdays, the frequency is every 8-15 minutes.

2. Green Line

With 30 metro stations on the route, the Green Line connects North Bangalore to South Bangalore, from Nagasandra to Silk Institute. The significant stations in this metro route are K.R Market, Rajajinagar, and Sampige Road. In this route, the frequency is the same as other lines – every 5-15 minutes during rush hours.

3. Yellow Line

Currently under construction, the Yellow Line of the Bengaluru metro route extends for 18.82 km and links Electronic City with BTM Layout. The route is designed with 16 stations, featuring interchanging options. From the Yellow Line, you can seamlessly commute to the Pink Line, Blue Line, and Green Line.

4. Orange Line

Officially known as the ORR-West Line, the Orange Line is part of Phase 3A of Namma Metro. The line will be an elevated corridor and extends 31 km along the Outer Ring Road. The Orange Line also connects Hebbal from JP Nagar and features an interchange with the Blue Line. This new line is likely to attract potential homebuyers with desirable neighbourhoods.

5. Blue Line

How many times have you lost the willpower to commute to and from the airport? Connecting Kasturi Nagar to the airport, the Blue Line will establish a link spanning 18.23 km from K.R Puram to Silk Board. The line hosts 13 stations, establishing a link with prominent areas such as Mahadevpura, Bellandur, and HSR Layout.

6. Pink Line

With 12 underground stations and 6 elevated stations, the Pink Line covers around 21 km. It is currently under construction and will connect Kalena Agrahara to Nagawara. It will also connect prominent areas such as MG Road and IIM Bangalore.

Also read: Travel in Bangalore by Metro Green Line

Travel Tips When Taking Bangalore Metro

1. Plan in advance: Use the Namma Metro app or BMRCL website to check real-time train timings and plan your journey accordingly.

2. Peak Hours: Try not to travel during peak hours for a more comfortable ride.

3. Smart Card: Invest in a Metro Smart Card to save time and money. This card offers discounts and eliminates the need to queue for tickets.

4. Accessibility: Metro stations are equipped with facilities for different passengers such as elevators and ramps.

5. Safety: Follow metro guidelines such as staying behind the yellow line on the platform and holding the handles inside the train.

In Conclusion

Bangalore Metro offers a safe and efficient mode of transportation, making it a great choice for daily commuters and tourists. With its extensive network, convenient time and modern amenities, Namma Metro provides fast and convenient access to your destination. So, hop on the metro and explore the vibrant city of Bangalore with ease!

Ready to make your trip hassle-free? Plan your Bangalore Metro trip today!

Also read: Banashankari Metro Station: Timings, Routes And Facilities

Frequently Asked Questions:

Q: What are the first and last trains of Bangalore Metro?

A: The first train leaves at 5:00 AM and the last train leaves until 11:00 AM.

Q: Are there special services for holidays or events?

A: Yes, BMRCL often extends train services during major festivals and city events. Check the official notification for updates.

Q: How can I get real-time updates on train times?

A: Use the Namma Metro app or visit BMRCL website for time updates and route information.
